name: UIInterpolatingMotionEffect
desc: An object that maps the horizontal or vertical tilt of a device to values that you specify so that UIKit can apply those values to your views.

items.name: init(keyPath: String, type: UIInterpolatingMotionEffect.EffectType)
items.desc: Initializes and returns an interpolating motion effect object configured for the specific tilt direction.

items.name: var keyPath: String
items.desc: The key path you want to modify on the view.

items.name: var minimumRelativeValue: Any?
items.desc: The value that maps to the minimum viewer offset.

items.name: var maximumRelativeValue: Any?
items.desc: The value that maps to the maximum viewer offset.

items.name: enum UIInterpolatingMotionEffect.EffectType
items.desc: The axis to use when interpolating values.
